message.content:
cs.DC, cs.LO, cs.PL, cs.SE, cs.SY

Reasoning: The paper deals with formal specifications and synthesis of distributed systems, which are typically studied in the subfield of Distributed Computing (cs.DC). The use of temporal logic (LTL) suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the subfield of Logic in Computer Science (cs.LO). The paper also mentions bounded synthesis, which is a technique used in Program Analysis and Verification (cs.PL). The focus on fault-tolerant systems suggests that the paper may be relevant to the subfield of Software Engineering (cs.SE). Finally, the paper deals with the problem of distributed realizability, which is a central topic in the subfield of Control and Systems Theory (cs.SY).
